item.description: What do Brodsky, Yeats and Yemeni poetics have in common? Find out at this event sponsored by the Woodberry Poetry Room at Harvard. Poet and scholar Eugene Ostashevsky will speak about the declamatory mode of reading -- a method common to each of the aforementioned three authors/traditions, and provocative counterpoint to some of the prevalent monotone, podium-bound modes. Introduction by Professor Stephanie Sandler. This seminar and reading is free and open to the public.
item.name: The Declamatory Manner of Reading Poetry: Eugene Ostashevksy
